articles.title: South Florida hospital employee discharged nine months after contracting COVID-19 - WFLA
articles.description: Due to her underlying health conditions, which include asthma and diabetes, Rosa became gravely ill. She was intubated and spent two months in the intensive care unit at the very place where she worked for 15 years.
articles.content:
MIAMI (WFLA/WTVJ) – After fighting COVID-19 since the beginning of the pandemic nine months ago, Rosa Felipe was released from Jackson Memorial Hospital in Miami on Tuesday.
